function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Insufficient research on the role of infrastructure in pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient planning and design of infrastructure for halting the spread of pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of economic potential of infrastructure in preparing or responding to pandemics","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overlooked relationship between infrastructure, agglomeration, and pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate identification of interventions due to rapid review process.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete integration of lessons from historical pandemics prior to 1900.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapidly evolving knowledge in the field of pandemic planning and urban connections.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective screening criteria leads to inclusion of irrelevant articles","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of relevant articles based on abstract and title screening","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of temperature and in-sewer travel time on virus detectability","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global monitoring of 2.1 billion people in sewage treatment plants","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the information gleaned from monitoring for sars-cov-2 rna in wastewater","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential bias in wastewater temperature as a source of data bias in wastewater-based epidemiology","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimation of initial sars-cov-2 loads and persistence in wastewater","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of contagious diseases through wastewater collection system","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimation of wastewater loading and population density could result in inaccurate representation of actual wastewater flows and population exposure to contaminants.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No incorporation of leakage or infiltration in the hydraulic model could underestimate the potential for pathogen transport and spread in the collection system.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of outdated or inaccurate modeling software for hydraulic modeling could lead to errors in the representation of wastewater flow rates and travel times.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variation in per-assay costs of clinical and wbe screening due to geospatial differences and labor costs.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High sars-cov-2 load in wastewater, leading to elevated concentrations of viral genomes.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient information on virus shedding by symptomatic and asymptomatic individuals","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential loss of qrt pcr signal in sewer from virus degradation and rna loss","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of reliable data for loss of sars-cov-2 from in-sewer degradation under different temperature regimes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of wastewater temperature on virus load stability and degradation","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of seasonal temperature changes on biomarker degradation in wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting the impact of temperature on degradation of biomarkers in wastewater can lead to error propagation into estimates of upstream discharge, consumption, exposure, and excretion.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wastewater-based epidemiology wbe studies that do not adjust monitoring results to temperature risk significant under- or over-estimation of the true temporal changes occurring in virus shedding within the community.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global wastewater temperature modeling can help in predicting the impact of temperature on the degradation of biomarkers in wastewater, providing a basis for informed decision-making in public health responses.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for prolonged virus survival in sewer lines due to temperature changes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimation of covid-19 prevalence due to seasonal temperature changes and wastewater temperatures","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changing population focus for wastewater-based epidemiology wbe observations due to seasonal temperature changes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Seasonal weather conditions influencing the persistence of sars-cov-2 in sewer systems","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of wastewater sampling in reflecting the health status of the population","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Practicability and cost considerations of clinical testing and wastewater-based epidemiology wbe","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High cost of individual clinical testing for large populations may limit the frequency and scope of testing, leading to delayed or incomplete identification of infected individuals.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited clinical testing capacity compared to population size may result in slow and costly screening processes, hindering effective assessment and management of contagious disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate detection limit and precision of quantitative data","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Logistical challenges and costs of wbe approach","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to wbe for certain regions and populations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large sample volumes and effective concentration of virus particles may lower method detection limits.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Desire to keep required sample sizes low for economic shipping.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for a study on the decay and detectability of sars-cov-2 as a function of temperature.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wastewater-based epidemiology wbe may not fully replace clinical testing for covid-19 and may need to be used in conjunction with clinical testing.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations in global access to centrally collected wastewater for wbe may restrict its effectiveness in certain regions.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Diverting resources from clinical testing to wbe may affect the accuracy and timeliness of covid-19 surveillance and response.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Financial interests in startup companies related to the study’s intellectual space","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Founding a nonprofit project providing wastewater-based health assessments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disintegrated and non-interoperable data inhibits computer-assisted reasoning, hindering artificial intelligence.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of bioinformatics tools hinders integration and analysis of heterogeneous data and knowledge.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on ontologies for data standardization and knowledge representation poses a single point of failure risk.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"}]}
